elements.title: A New Theory for Systems That Defy Newton’s Third Law
elements.contents: In nonreciprocal systems, where Newton’s third law falls apart, “exceptional points” are helping researchers understand phase transitions and possibly other phenomena.

elements.title: Laws of Logic Lead to New Restrictions on the Big Bang
elements.contents: Physicists are translating commonsense principles into strict mathematical constraints on how our universe must have behaved at the beginning of time.

elements.title: Researchers Revise Recipe for Building a Rocky Planet Like Earth
elements.contents: Over the past decade, researchers have completely rewritten the story of how gas giants such as Jupiter and Saturn form. They’re now debating whether the same process might hold for Earth.

elements.title: Is the Great Neutrino Puzzle Pointing to Multiple Missing Particles?
elements.contents: Years of conflicting neutrino measurements have led physicists to propose a “dark sector” of invisible particles — one that could simultaneously explain dark matter, the puzzling expansion of the universe, and other mysteries.
